column4: I downloaded and installed ubuntu now and it's my first time using this os... I had a great time with my first day and it seems that I'm getting it. I can't find the programming language support though? any idea on this?
c++,java
ok
i thought you have to go to -sudo or something
For Java I would recommend eclipse. If you want to program in C++ I would choose the Qt Creator as an IDE
so i have to go to the package manager
so which is much better install the ide's packed with the compilers?
like codeblocks and eclipse?
or install it via package manager
depends on your needs I guess. if you do not have any special recommendations you can install them via package manager
s/recommendations/requirements/ ;)
is that a directory which i can access through the terminal?
I am so noob
what kind of directory do you mean? if you mean the package manager I would recommend the "GUI" way via synaptic
hahahha not that
the s/recommendations/requirements u say
sori man
no problem ;)
sorry, gotta be off now. perhaps someone else can guide you to install the IDEs you want :)
guess i have to study more on linux commands and the architecture of it... I totally love this ubuntu
I'll just google it...
ah, it should not be that difficult. everything you need can be found in the repositories, I guess
